page.title: 13Population and housing.
page.content: {Traditional }Cotswold stone houses which are located away from the built up area are especially sought after and are thus particularly expensive to purchase. As a result of these present social trends the area is becoming increasingly "middle-class",and the settlements are said to be becoming {"gentrified".}The houses are thus occupied by people who have better paid jobs and can afford at least one car to enable them to commute to work.It is difficult for young married couples to buy houses in this area. The{popualtion}has,however, grown in recent years because of the more {mobile executive type }moving into the area with their families.The growth of population reflects the national trend of more rapid growth in villages located near to small towns.
